{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3480811,"name":"","username":"Taltan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/bbe5ce/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-13T09:02:42.385Z","cooked":"

We’re having trouble validating our module configuration in Phoenix Tuner X Swerve Generator. We are sure that we’re setting the correct motors in module config. We use Kraken for drive and Falcon for turning. When the module test is initiated, the specified motor doesnt move. We can control the said motors from the devices tab in Tuner X and plot the cancoders. We use roborio 2, the server version is 2025.1.0, the motors and the cancoders are 2025.1.0.0. Tuner X version is 2025.2.0.0.

Although we havent wired canivore in our robot yet, we tried wiring one temporarily to test if it’d differ, but we didnt get any different results.

When tried to validate module config and initiate tests, no motor moves. An error within the lines of “average velocity (vel:0) was below threshold” for both motors and cancoder appears.

Thanks for your help.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-13T09:02:42.385Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":157,"reads":131,"readers_count":130,"score":811.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":481354,"topic_slug":"unable-to-validate-module-configuration-in-ctre-phoenix-tuner-x-swerve-generator","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71185,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/unable-to-validate-module-configuration-in-ctre-phoenix-tuner-x-swerve-generator/481354/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3480812,"name":"Can Toğran","username":"cantogr07","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cantogr07/{size}/208647_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-13T09:05:32.847Z","cooked":"

Can you verify that you can move the related module motor using the Phoenix Tuner X interface?

We are having a similar issue (both module validations fail in Tuner X), however our modules are moving during the test but only when we run the TunerX directly connected to the Canivore via USB.

We are running latest firmware (v6 2025) on swerve modules and Canivore. Also, Rio 2 is updated to latest firmware.

Other observations…
When connecting the TunerX directly to the Canivore using USB we can see all the modules and the Canivore STAT light is solid green.
When Canivore is connected to the RIO 2 (using USB) and RIO is connected to laptop (USB) we can’t see any modules and the Canivore STAT light is solid orange

The validation issue and the Canivore/RIO communication issue may be unrelated. But I’m still not able to Validate using the Phoenix Tuner.

Thanks for any help you provide!
Karl
Mentor
7491 Cyber Soldiers.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-14T01:16:46.153Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":78.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":481354,"topic_slug":"unable-to-validate-module-configuration-in-ctre-phoenix-tuner-x-swerve-generator","display_username":"karlf","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33059,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/unable-to-validate-module-configuration-in-ctre-phoenix-tuner-x-swerve-generator/481354/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3482844,"name":"karlf","username":"karlf","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/c0e974/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T00:28:50.113Z","cooked":"

Well, this is a little embarrassing but in the interest of helping others, I’ll share my experience. The good news is that we have it working now. The big mistake we made was to not have the driver station enabled during the validation steps in the Phoenix Tuner X (note to self… stop and read the dialog boxes, sigh!) That solved the problem of not being able to validate each module via RIO USB. The other issues were minor and related to can bus wiring (we tried a few different wiring configs) and a few modules weren’t showing up on the right can bus.

Finally, I also noticed tonight, that the Phoenix Tuner X had been updated, and the mechanism configuration screen now has a slightly different look, with an extra dropdown used to select the steer encoder type before selecting the can bus ID.

I sincerely hope this can help others along the way. Good luck and happy swerving!

Karl

What code are you uploading to run the module configuration?We installed the library and uploaded the empty code.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T20:13:15.339Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":36,"readers_count":35,"score":17.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":481354,"topic_slug":"unable-to-validate-module-configuration-in-ctre-phoenix-tuner-x-swerve-generator","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":33059,"username":"karlf","name":"karlf","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/c0e974/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71185,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/unable-to-validate-module-configuration-in-ctre-phoenix-tuner-x-swerve-generator/481354/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3484961,"name":"karlf","username":"karlf","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/c0e974/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-16T21:21:40.794Z","cooked":"

I don’t exactly remember what we did for the code. I don’t think it matters what code is uploaded. I think the code is only needed to enable the robot. I don’t think the validation routine needs a specific code base and may work without it as long as you’re running the diagnostic software via the Tuner X app. You could generate a new project and upload that. I think that’s what we did, since we’d re-imaged the RIO 2 SD card it didn’t have any code on the robot so at one point we uploaded that new blank project. Sorry for being so vague, we were doing a lot of things to try and get it to work so I don’t remember the intermediate steps exactly.

Hope that helps.
Karl
